bioghist.p: Raised in Staten Island, New York, Father Edmund J. Dobbin received his B.A. in Philosophy from Villanova in 1958. In 1962, he received his Master of Arts from Augustinian College as theological preparation for his ordination to the priesthood. In 1964, Father Dobbin received his Master of Science in Mathematics, with a minor in Physics, and in 1968, he received his Licentiate in Sacred Theology, both degrees from the Catholic University of America. In 1971, he received his Doctor of Sacred Theology from the University of Louvain, Belgium. A recognized scholar and administrator, Father Dobbin served as a member of the Villanova University Board of Trustees from 1979 to 1987. He was appointed associate vice president for Academic Affairs in 1987, a position he held until his inauguration as president of Villanova University in 1988. In 2006, after 18 years as president, Father Dobbin stepped down to resume teaching at the University.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of Father Edmund J. Dobbin. The collection includes administrative files, correspondence, legal records, minutes, personal papers, printed materials, and programs and reports. Administrative records include information on the Alumni Association, Board of Trustees resolutions and membership lists, policy statements, and a list of recipients of honorary degrees (1877-1992). Correspondence makes up a large portion of the collection and dates from 1988 to 2005. The correspondence covers a wide range of University matters, including alumni affairs, athletics, faculty matters, commencements and honorary degrees, admissions, Ex Corde Ecclesiae, public relations, dissolution of the Library Science department, development, and student life. The legal documents include records on estates, zoning, leases, West Campus development, and faculty and student legal matters. Minutes, agendas, and related memoranda are present for various committees of the Board of Trustees (1988-2006); the University Senate and a number of its committees (1988-2005); the Vice Presidentâ€™s Council (1989-2006); and other University committees and councils. Personal papers include daily calendars (1988-2005); correspondence (1987-2005); and addresses delivered by Father Dobbin at commencements and meetings of the Faculty Council and University Senate. Finally, the collection includes a large number of printed materials, programs, and reports from a variety of University offices and committees as well as other associations. These materials cover topics ranging from athletics, academics, student life, development, strategic planning, facilities management, and self-studies and assessments. The collection also includes newspaper clippings and articles about Father Dobbin.
